thread.title: Riverheads, Lee move up in VHSL ratings
thread.title_full: Riverheads, Lee move up in VHSL ratings

title: Riverheads, Lee move up in VHSL ratings
text:
Riverheads, Lee move up in VHSL ratings Tom Jacobs , tjacobs@newsleader.com 10:23 a.m. EDT October 8, 2015 Marston Jones, left, and Stuarts Draft remain second in Group 2A East in this week's VHSL football ratings. (Photo: Mike Tripp/The News Leader) 82 CONNECT 5 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Stuarts Draft, Robert E. Lee and Riverheads helped themselves quite a bit this week in the VHSL’s weekly football ratings. 
The Cougars remain at No. 2 in 2A East after their 47-0 win over Stonewall Jackson, while the Leemen moved up from 12th to ninth, thanks to their win over 3A school Broadway. The Bison, last week’s No. 1, fell to fifth in the region. 
The Gladiators, who rallied to beat previously unbeaten Gap last Thursday, moved up to No. 1 in Group 1A East ahead of Essex, which fell to No. 2. 
In 3A West, Waynesboro fell two spots to No. 13 after its loss to Harrisonburg last week. 
The ratings, which determine the teams in each region that will advanced to postseason play, are an average of points from a formula that includes opponents’ classification, in-district or out-of-district status, and wins and losses by teams already beaten or defeated. 
The top 16 teams in 2A East and 3A West qualify for the postseason. The top 12 teams in 1A East make the playoffs, with the top four seeds receiving first-round byes. 
Stuarts Draft (4-1) has a 19.80 rating, placing it behind new No. 1 Goochland (20.25), which was seventh last week before hammering Randolph-Henry last week 49-28. Clark County (19.60) is third, with the Bison and Amelia County tied for fourth with 19.40. 
Stuarts Draft visits Buffalo Gap on Friday in a game that is sure to shake up next week’s ratings. 
Lee improved its rating from 14.20 to 16.50 to make its move into the top 10. The Leemen are .30 points behind Strasburg, which fell to No. 8 after being tied for third with Clarke County last week, and could make another jump in the ratings with a Homecoming win Friday over 3A Waynesboro. 
It was a tough week for Wilson Memorial, which dropped from a tie for 17th last week to No. 21 with an average of 12.00. The Green Hornets are 1.88 points behind No. 16 Madison County. 
Riverheads’ win over the Bison, combined with Essex’s 35-6 loss on the road at Monroe in Fredericksburg, put the Gladiators in the top spot with a 24.00 rating. The Trojans’ average fell to 22.40 to put them in the No. 2 spot, with Franklin (20.50), Luray (19.00) and Lancaster (18.80) rounding out the top five. Stonewall Jackson held on to the No. 16 spot in the region. 
The Little Giants’ rating in 3A West dipped from 18.00 last week to 16.67 this week. Brookville, Magna Vista, Western Albemarle, Staunton River and Abingdon make up the top five in the region. 
Weekly Rankings as of Oct. 7 
Group 2A East 
1. Goochland 20.25, 2. Stuarts Draft 19.80, 3. Clarke County 19.60, 4. (tie) Buffalo Gap and Amelia County 19.40, 6. George Mason 17.50, 7. Brunswick 17.25, 8. Strasburg 16.80, 9. Robert E. Lee 16.50, 10. King William 16.40, 11. Washington & Lee 14.80, 12. Greensville 14.75, 13. Central Woodstock 14.60, 14. (tie) East Rockingham and Bruton 14.00, 16. Madison County 13.60, 17. (tie) Arcadia and Prince Edward 12.80, 19. Nottoway 12.60, 20. Bluestone 12.25, 21. Wilson Memorial 12.00. 
Group 1A East 
1. Riverheads 24.00, 2. Essex 22.40, 3. Franklin 20.50, 4. Luray 19.00, 5. Lancaster 18.80, 6. William Campbell 18.60, 7. (tie) Rappahannock 17.20, 8. Central Lunenberg 17.17; 9. Altavista 16.80, 10. Sussex Central 16.20, 11. Middlesex 15.80, 12. Northumberland 13.80, 13. Mathews 13.20, 14. Cumberland 12.25, 15. Surry 11.75, 16. Stonewall Jackson-Quicksburg 11.20. 
Group 3A West 
1. Brookville 26.83, 2. Magna Vista 24.40, 3. Western Albemarle 22.80, 4. Staunton River 22.00, 5. Abingdon 21.80, 6. (tie) Lord Botetourt and Northside 21.50, 8. Monticello 21.00, 9. Rustburg 20.67, 10. (tie) Turner Ashby and Blacksburg 19.00, 12. Alleghany 18.33, 13. Waynesboro 17.66, 14. Broadway 16.33, 15. Heritage Lynchburg 15.60, 16. Liberty Bedford 15.33, 17. Christiansburg 15.00, 18. Cave Spring 14.8, 19. Patrick County 14.33, 20.
